intro: Hookera sellowiana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are broad and hairy, adapted to the cold and arid conditions of its habitat. Hookera sellowiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
